intro: Pimelea neoanglica, commonly known as the New Zealand tea tree, is a small shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow, leathery, and often have a slight aromatic scent. Pimelea neoanglica is well adapted to the coastal and subalpine environments of its native habitat.
